classes.name: BBjAPI
classes.docu: The BBjAPI object is the entry point for creating and using BBj Objects. See https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi.htm

methods.name: getFileSystem
methods.docu: Obtains a BBjFileSystem object that allows interaction with the BBj filesystem. See https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getfilesystem.htm

methods.name: openSysGui
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method obtains a BBjSysGui object that represents a SysGui channel and is used to facilitate the creation and manipulation of custom graphical windows and controls in a GUI application. see https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_opensysgui.htm

constructors.name: BBjAPI
constructors.docu: Creates a new instance of BBjAPI.

classes.name: BBjFileSystem
classes.docu: The BBjFileSystem provides methods for interacting with the filesystem.

methods.name: resolvePath
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns the fully resolved absolute path for the specified file name. The file name can be a file relative to any configured prefix configurations. When a BBx program makes a call to OPEN passing in a relative path to a file, BBj checks any configured prefixes to look for the specified file in those locations. This method returns the full path BBj would use in a call to OPEN. See https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_resolvePath.htm
